result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: EP
Defendant Jeffrey E Grenlie in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:07 a.m. case is called. 
14CF279 & 280
Appearances stated on the record by ADA 
This hearing is being held in the small courtroom as there are number of child support actions in the main courtroom.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement for 3 cases - 14CF61, 14CF279 and 14CF280.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant verifies signature on Plea Questionnaire.  Court questions
 the defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Court informs of the potential penalties 

14CF61
Ct #1 in Amended Information in 14CF61.  Defendant enters a plea of: NC

14CT38 
- OAR
Court questions the defendant and informs of potential penalites
 
Defendant enters a Plea:  NC 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge(s) in 14CF61 and 14CT38.
  Defendant replies to the court.  
**Court advises Cannot vote**

Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
  Attorney Kryshak replies to the court.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).  

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty as in the amended information.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CT finds sufficient factual basis.  Finds defendant guilty.

Court dismisses 14CF279 and reads that into the record.
ADA states the victims have been notified and no victim is present.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
 Prior convictions:  11CF344 Wood County w/h sentence; 11CM660 Wood County case; 12CF262 - Portage County is imposed and stayed
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Court plea agreement is fair and appropriate.
14CF61
Impose indeteminate setence of 4 years in prison  1 year confire and 3 extends sup
Concurrent to probation revocation 
--Conditions:
Any assessment done by DOC and any treatment recommend
Resitution to Opal Custer in the amount of $___________.
--25% of prison accounts
Grants earned release program for this offense
No challenge incarceration 
Pay court costs
Pay DNA surcharge 
Submit DNA sample, if not already done
Parties are to advise the court of jail credit by the end of the week.

14CT28
$100 fine + costs

ADA requests the bond not be forfeited and be applied

Court states the bond needs to be applied to restitution first

10:33 a.m. case is concluded.
$4,000 cash bond to cover all cases (14CT38, 14CF61, 14CF279).

Defendant Jeffrey E Grenlie appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Defendant as to reasons for missing court.
Warrant are quashed.
Defendant wants to be sentenced today.
BTC: Cases:   $4,000 cash bond to cover all cases (14CT38, 14CF61, 14CF279).

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
